item.title: Supporting Black educators is critical.
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Supporting Black educators is critical.

Black Lives Matter 5280

#CTA #Calltoaction Black afternoon fam and friends! Don't know about y'all, but we are still in our feelings about the lack of Black nominees for #ColoradoTeach...eroftheYear. From your shout outs we put together a list of 32 Black educators in Denver and Aurora that deserve all the props for their #Blackeducatorexcellence! We're excited to share that BLM5280 is pledging to honor their general dopeness with a $50 award to each nominee BUT if we can get 160 of y‚Äôall to give just $10 we can double that and send each educator $100! Send your contribution at the link below and be sure to label it ‚Äò#BlackEducatorsMatter‚Äô.

www.venmo.com/BLM5280

Like, share, and comment 'done!' so this post doesn't get buried! ‚úäüèø‚úäüèø‚úäüèø

item.title: Our friends at Denver Alliance for Street Health Response have a...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Our friends at Denver Alliance for Street Health Response have a series of offerings to prepare all of us for the next few weeks and the weeks and months that follow. These include protest safety and first aid (October 21), mutual aid (October 22 and 27), Legal Observer Training (October 24 and 29), and Community Defense (October 28).

Please go to their page for more details on how to register for these events and as always if you can support DASHR's ongoing work please donate: https://www.gofundme.com/f/supporting-dashr039s-community-r‚Ä¶.

Denver Alliance for Street Health Response

Join DASHR, Colorado Jobs with Justice/Trabajos con Justicia and community partners for a series on Democracy Defense and Community Resistance. So far 2020 has ...been full of crises for working people, including the COVID-19 pandemic, economic crisis, ongoing white supremacy, climate chaos, and more. As we head into a very contentious election ‚Äì we should plan for what could feel like more chaos. There are a number of scenarios on election day, and more importantly in the days after the election.

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: You are invited to attend a virtual town hall about ‚ÄúRace on...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

You are invited to attend a virtual town hall about ‚ÄúRace on the Ballot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vote" on Wednesday, October 21, from 4:30-6 p.m. Please register in advance at this link: http://bit.ly/raceontheballot

About the event:
Denver has more than 20 initiatives on our ballot this election season. Some of us wonder how our votes on these initiatives will reflect racial equity, an issue of critical importance to many in our community. "Race on the Bal...lot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vote" will bring together panelists, each of whom will discuss a ballot initiative through the lens of racial equity. The goal of this virtual event is to inform and empower participants to use a racial equity lens when interpreting their ballots. This is a community educational opportunity to raise our collective social consciousness for the 2020 election and beyond.

The panelists are as follows:
- Dr. Apryl Alexander, Associate Professor at the University of Denver, an organizer with Black Lives Matter 5280, and a board member for the Colorado Juvenile Defender Center will speak about Proposition 115 (banning abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy).
- Representative James Coleman, Colorado State Legislator and Executive Director of FaithBridge, will speak about the Gallagher Amendment, which relates to property taxes.
- Iman Jodeh, Executive Director of Meet the Middle East, Community Advocate and Liaison for the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, and candidate for Colorado House District 41, will speak about family leave.
- Representative Adrienne Benavidez of House District 32
- Imam Abdur-Rahim Ali, leader of the Northeast Denver Islamic Center, will speak about an initiative of his choice.

Rev Amanda Henderson, Executive Director of the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, will moderate this event.

Current event partners and co-hosts:
Cameron Church's Good Trouble initiative
COLOR (Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity and Reproductive Rights)
Curious Theatre Company
Emancipation Theater Co
The Interfaith Alliance of Colorado
Mountain Sky Conference of the United Methodist Church
Progress Now Colorado
Sacred Stones Ministries
Scott United Methodist Church
Showing Up for Racial Justice (SURJ) - Denver
Soul2Soul Sisters

See More

secure.everyaction.com

Race on the Ballot

item.title: The #CelestialAlegria #ReparationsNetwork is collecting...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

The #CelestialAlegria #ReparationsNetwork is collecting financial contributions throughout the next month. Make your contribution TODAY - and spread the word!
Venmo @Celeste-Martinez-129 or PayPal.Me/CelestialAlegria

Celestial Alegr√≠a

The #CelestialAlegria #ReparationsNetwork is a community funded action to make $500 reparations to 10 different Black leaders, artists and organizations that I ...run in tandem each time
I offer the Confronting Anti-Blackness program for Latinx and Chicanx folx.

Since the Confronting Anti-Blackness program relaunched last Saturday, I am once again raising $5,000 by November 14th for the Reparations Network! I invite you to be a part by making a financial contribution today at Venmo @Celeste-Martinez-129 or PayPal.Me/CelestialAlegria

Together we are building our own system of collective care! Together we are making reparations a reality!

Thank you for your continued support and all the ways you will take action for this community effort.

#Reparations #DefendBlackLives #BLM #BlackLivesMatter #BlackLiberation #ConfrontAntiBlackness #BlackAndBrownUnity #Solidarity #RacialJustice #CollectiveCare #Joy #Transformation #Healing #LifeCoach #Organizer #Leader #Trainer #Consultant

item.title: Sanctuary4All Colorado has another round of solidarity meals!...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Sanctuary4All Colorado has another round of solidarity meals!

This week the meals will fund/support Gaby! Gaby needs $10,000 to appeal the decision made in her husband‚Äôs case, as he was recently deported. She's also been supporting their family on her own since.

Please support Gaby by purchasing cebiche ($12) from her! Also on offer this week, spring fling cake from Lupe! ...
tinyurl.com/solidaritymeals-10-17

Food pickup available this Saturday 12:00 - 2:00 pm from a Denver Cap Hill location or a location near Arapahoe Ridge Park in Boulder. SURJ (Showing Up for Racial Justice) Families of Boulder County Showing Up For Racial Justice - SURJ Boulder

item.title: In the past couple of days, Colorado People's Alliance has...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

In the past couple of days, Colorado People's Alliance has received alarming news of a COVID-19 outbreak at the Aurora GEO detention facility -19 cases, and 2 additional just confirmed. GEO has shown repeatedly that they can't keep detainees safe, before and especially not during a pandemic.

COPA is calling on all of us to demand the release of detainees on humanitarian parole.

You can:

...

1. Call ICE and demand the release of detainees 720-873-2899
2. Call warden Johnny Choate to demand medical care for those detained 303-361-6612.
3. Sign up to be a volunteer for COPA's detention lifeline.

#FreeThemAll
#VivosNoMuertos

See MoreShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverSend Message

item.title: Solidarity statement with the arrested anti-racist organizers in...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Solidarity statement with the arrested anti-racist organizers in Denver

We at SURJ Denver stand in solidarity with the anti-racist organizers who were arrested in Denver, Colorado as part of a coordinated police operation. We demand their immediate freedom and that the charges against them be dropped.

On Sept. 17, several protest leaders, including four members of the Party for Socialism and Liberation, were arrested in Denver, Colorado in a coordinated police attack. The org...anizers now face over 30 bogus charges including ‚Äúkidnapping‚Äù and ‚Äúinciting a riot,‚Äù and potentially years in prison. They were targeted because of their dedicated organizing efforts in recent months to denouncing the police murder of Elijah McClain in Aurora, Colorado.

The same District Attorney, Dave Young, who has refused to charge the police officers who murdered Elijah McClain, directed these felony arrests of the organizers who have been protesting against him. He is engaged in a corrupt abuse of his authority to silence his critics and the demands for racial justice, a declaration of war against the First Amendment.

This attack goes hand in hand with the assault on the anti-racist movement directed from the White House, from Governor‚Äôs mansions, and from local police departments around the country.

We understand that this can happen to any protester, who has used their voice to mobilize in the mass movement against racism in every single corner of the United States. We stand united against this attack on civil liberties and the ongoing movement for Black Lives.

Demands:
Free the anti-racist organizers from jail immediately!
Drop all the charges!
Stop the assault on the movement and on free speech!
In solidarity,
Add your name here: https://www.pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

See MoreWe are calling on all individuals and organizations who care about justice and free speech to unite in this fight to defend the protest movement, and free these Denver-area organizers. More than ever, it is crucial that we stand together and united to say that ‚Äúan injury to one is an injury to all...

pslweb.org

Sign-On Statement: Drop the Charges on Denver Anti-Racist Organizers

We are calling on all individuals and organizations who care about justice and free speech to unite in this fight to defend the protest movement, and free these Denver-area organizers. More than ever, it is crucial that we stand together and united to say that ‚Äúan injury to one is an injury to all...We are calling on all individuals and organizations who care about justice and free speech to unite in this fight to defend the protest movement, and free these Denver-area organizers. More than ever, it is crucial that we stand together and united to say that ‚Äúan injury to one is an injury to all...

item.title: This week's Solidarity Meals menu is up! Kesha...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

This week's Solidarity Meals menu is up! Kesha Davalos-Grijalva is selling tacos to pay for her husband's immigration lawyer. You will hopefully remember Kesha, her mother, and her daughter from the Abolish ICE Denver encampment at GEO this summer. Her husband, Pablo, was incarcerated at GEO and was moved to Teller County Jail, largely in retaliation for her fight to free him and all incarcerated immigrants detained in GEO and other prison facilities. She needs our support to... continue this fight.

order: https://tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-9-26
venmo: @kesha-davalos
pickup: Denver or Boulder between noon-2 PM on 9/26

images: solidarity meals | September 26. All tacos served with salsa verde, lettuce, tomato, queso, and crema. tacos fritos de pollo (4 fried chicken tacos) - $12, tacos fritos de papa y champi√±on (4 fried potato and mushroom tacos)- $12

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Next week‚Äôs menu is up! Kesha will be selling tacos to help pay for her husband‚Äôs immigration lawyer. You can order at tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-9-26

item.title: Solidarity fund for the legal fees of the anti-racism organizers...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Solidarity fund for the legal fees of the anti-racism organizers who were arrested. The community will not be threatened into keeping quiet and ignoring the continued horror that police bring to communities.

First Amendment Freedom Fund Fundraiser for Candice BaileyToday I am standing in solidarity with and for the 6 freedom fighters who have been illegally detained for exerc...ising their first amendment rights. I will amplify the injustice and be the voice for my community. If this is justice we must start accessing why we align with a system that would make the innocent, guilty while their comrades wreak havoc on our country. We must stand!
Please help me to get funds together for legal counsel and bail.
This is the moment when all of you who have wanted to help can get active. Share this. Donate and amplify the voice of freedom and liberty for all! Continue Reading$7,677 raised of $1,000,000Ended
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Denver and Aurora police departments are using scare tactics to...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Denver and Aurora police departments are using scare tactics to try and stop the organizing and uprisings that have been happening in Denver due to police continuing to brutalize and murder communities of color.

Their most recent tactic was to arrest anti-racism organizers who have been leading the charge against the Aurora police who murdered Elijah McClain. Yesterday, several organizers from the Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver and Frontline Party for Revolution...ary Action were arrested on trumped up charges including kidnapping due to occupation OF A BUILDING. Yet Elijah‚Äôs killers and the individuals who drove their Jeep through a crowd of protesters have yet to see repercussions for their actions.

Join us Saturday at noon to demand these charges be dropped and that the real criminals, the murderers of Elijah McClain, be held accountable.

See More

SAT, SEP 19

Drop the Charges! Solidarity with Arrested Anti-Racist Organizers

Colorado State Capitol

¬∑ DenverCauses ¬∑ 1,222 people

item.title: White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are your actions and decisions centering Black, Indigenous, and People of Color? This document provides guidance on how to prioritize the vision of BIPOC organizers, tips for keeping safe during actions, and direction for white accomplices acting in a security/marshal role. This document also includes BIPOC led organizations doing amazing work in Colorado.

https://bit.ly/2Mnw0Nd
